Our Goals

The key goals we strive to meet.

Your Safety

We want to provide accurate information you can use to keep yourself, your family, and friends safe while dining.

Easy to Interpret

We want to present the information in a way that makes it easy to identify where you can DINE-SAFE.

Cloud Analysis

Our proprietary algorithm combined with live imagery is automatically processed and leveraged to maintain up to date info.

Our Picks

Our hand pick selection of restaurants we personally recommend.

COVID Timeline

A short synopsis of where COVID began and where we are today.

  • January 21

    CDC Confirms First US Coronavirus Case

    A Washington state resident becomes the first person in the United States with a confirmed case of the 2019 novel coronavirus, having returned from Wuhan on January 15, thanks to overnight polymerase chain reaction testing. The CDC soon after deploys a team to help with the investigation, including potential use of contact tracing.

  • March 11

    WHO Declares COVID-19 a Pandemic

    In declaring COVID-19 a pandemic, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, director general of WHO, said at a briefing in Geneva the agency is “deeply concerned by the alarming levels of spread and severity” of the outbreak. He also expressed concern about “the alarming levels of inaction.”

  • June 10

    US COVID-19 Cases Reach 2 Million

    The number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 hits 2 million in the United States as new infections continue to rise in 20 states. Cases begin to spike as states ease social distancing restrictions.

  • Now

    COVID is still here and not going away

    At this point the United States has maintaned the highest number of total cases for months. Lack of consistency between federal and local governments combined with a general lack of understanding and/or following CDC Guidelines has kept COVID going. We are now finding ways to adapt to this new life style with Telework, Telehealth, and Socially Distanced interactions.

  • Dining
    Can
    Be Safe!
